lines.text: [first lines]
Well, that does it, Sam.
Well, according to my figures, we should have about five hundred head bottled up in the canyon. How'd you make out with the Bannion stock?
They got away with about half his herd. We can pick up the rest whenever we want 'em without any trouble.
Now listen, I don't want any killings. Understand?
Now who said anything about killings?
Well, I know you. You'd put a slug in your grandmother if she got in your way.
We've cleaned out this territory, Sam. How about unloadin' 'em to the Army.
Not yet.
We can get on hundred dollars a head right now and that's not bad!
It sure isn't, considerin' all we invested was a little energy. I think Lou's right. Five hundred head at a hundred dollars a head that's, ah, that's...
Don't strain yourself, kid, that's fifty thousand.
When you've forged as many bills of sale as I have, you'll see how simple it is.
Well, I hope you don't writer's cramp from forgin' 'em.
Well, I only hope that you keep those fancy six-shooters of yours in their holsters. You know when the government starts investigatin' murders, it ain't so easy to fool 'em.
You know as well as I do that we have to start usin' guns sooner or later.
Well, let's make it later and we'll be safer.
Anytime from now on is later, so you do the thinkin' and leave the shootin' to me.
Yeah, and I'll do the worryin'.
What's going on here and who are you?
The name's Wilson, Whip Wilson. And I might add that you're the best lookin' sheriff I've seen yet.
Are you really the sheriff here?
Acting sheriff. My father's the regular sheriff, but he's sick.
[Alice pulls her pistol]
Does that satisfy you?
Now we're getting someplace.

Very nice, ma'am, only if you were a man and tried that, you'd be dead by now. This gambling friend of yours here tried to take the life savings of an old homesteader in a card game. I happened along in time to prevent a killing. And where were you, Sheriff? Doing embroidery?
Thank you very much, ma'am. You know, it's a good thing there aren't too many law officers like you. I'd be in trouble *all* the time.
[the rustlers accuse Whip of horse-stealing]
What are you doin' with those horses?
I collect horses. It's a hobby of mine.
